macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Stock Market Divergence: Dow Up, Nasdaq Down as AI Concerns Persist
items.summary: On Friday, February 13, the Dow Jones rose 0.1% to 49,500.93 while the Nasdaq composite fell 0.2% to 22,546.67. The divergence reflects strong performance in value stocks and blue chips versus weakness in growth and tech sectors, driven by ongoing AI-disruption fears that caused Cisco to drop 12% on Thursday.

items.title: CPI Report Shows Inflation Cooling, Supporting Mid-Year Rate Cut Expectations
items.summary: The January 2026 CPI report came in slightly softer than expected, with headline CPI rising 0.2% month-over-month (2.4% year-over-year) and Core CPI rising 0.3% (2.5% year-over-year). The softer inflation data eased Treasury yields and boosted market sentiment, with the bond market now fully pricing in a July rate cut.

items.title: Weekly Losses: S&P 500 Down 1.4%, Nasdaq Down 2.1% for the Week
items.summary: For the week ending February 13, the S&P 500 declined 1.4%, the Dow fell 1.2%, and the Nasdaq dropped 2.1%, reflecting the impact of AI-related volatility and broader tech sector weakness despite Friday's modest recovery.

items.title: Year-to-Date Performance: Dow Outperforms, Nasdaq Lags, Small Caps Lead
items.summary: Year-to-date through February 13, the Dow is up 3%, the Russell 2000 is up 6.6%, while the S&P 500 is down 0.1% and the Nasdaq is down 3%. International emerging markets are significantly outperforming with an 11% year-to-date gain.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Closes at $68,900 on CME, Eyes $71K–$73K Next Week
items.summary: Bitcoin closed at $68,900 on the CME futures, signaling a potentially quiet weekend with range-bound price action. Analysts predict a possible move toward $71,000–$73,000 next week if buying momentum resumes.

items.title: Memecoin Selloff Nearing Exhaustion as Sentiment Hits Extreme Lows
items.summary: The memecoin market cap has dropped 34% over the past month amid broader crypto declines, with extreme negative sentiment suggesting a potential bottom according to Santiment. Historically, such lows have preceded rebounds as selling pressure fades.

items.title: Bitcoin ETF Investors Remain Steady Amid Volatility
items.summary: BlackRock reports minimal redemptions of just 0.2% from its iShares Bitcoin Trust (IBIT) during last week's market swings, despite the fund reaching nearly $100 billion. Major liquidations occurred on leveraged platforms, not ETFs.

items.title: Global Crypto Market Cap at $2.29T, Down 0.75% in Last 24 Hours
items.summary: The total cryptocurrency market capitalization stands at $2.29 trillion, reflecting a 0.75% decline over the past day per CoinMarketCap data.

items.title: Bitcoin Funding Rate Hits Critical Low, Signaling Potential Short Squeeze
items.summary: Bitcoin's funding rate has fallen to a critical level after a weak week, with bullish price momentum emerging on Friday, February 13th, potentially setting up a short squeeze.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: FOCaL: New Machine Learning Framework for Personalized Treatment Effects from Functional Data
items.summary: Researchers introduced FOCaL (Functional Outcome Causal Learner), a doubly robust meta-learner that estimates heterogeneous treatment effects from complex, continuous functional data like health trajectories over time. It outperforms existing methods in simulations and real-world datasets, advancing causal inference for personalized medicine and policy design.

items.title: AI Method Extracts Cross-Disciplinary Knowledge to Accelerate Alloy Discovery
items.summary: A new AI approach fuses expert knowledge from multiple disciplines with data to speed up alloy discovery in materials science. This advancement aims to enhance scientific research by integrating diverse insights for faster innovation.

items.title: Wall Street Analysts Crown Nvidia as Top AI Stock for February 2026
items.summary: Analysts project Nvidia's revenue to reach $213 billion in fiscal 2026 and $326 billion in 2027, driven by massive AI data center spending from hyperscalers. The stock is highlighted for its strong growth potential and dominant position in AI hardware.

items.title: AI in Education: Discussions at Machines Can Think 2026 Conference Highlight Practical Applications
items.summary: At the recent Machines Can Think 2026 conference in Abu Dhabi, experts discussed AI for grading, admissions, predictive analytics for student retention, scheduling, and campus security to boost efficiency amid rising administrative costs. Universities are implementing ethical guidelines while exploring productivity gains.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Seedance 2.0 AI Video Generator Sparks Hollywood Concerns
items.summary: ByteDance's Seedance 2.0 AI video generator produced a realistic 15-second clip of Tom Cruise and Brad Pitt fighting, prompting industry warnings that AI could soon create feature-length films indistinguishable from Hollywood productions.

items.title: Santa Monica Studios Reportedly Developing Cory Barlog Game Alongside God of War Trilogy Remake
items.summary: Insider sources suggest Santa Monica Studios is working on a new title by Cory Barlog in addition to the confirmed God of War Trilogy Remake, with a potential reveal expected this year at State of Play or Summer Game Fest.

items.title: Ubisoft Workers Launch International Strike Over Job Cuts and Return-to-Office Mandate
items.summary: Approximately 1,200 Ubisoft staff members went on strike in response to the company's massive cutbacks and mandatory return-to-office policies, highlighting ongoing labor tensions in the gaming industry.

items.title: World of Tanks Scheduled Maintenance and Micropatch Deployment
items.summary: World of Tanks servers underwent planned maintenance on February 14 to deploy Micropatch 2.1.1_4, with servers unavailable from 10:30 to 12:00 UTC.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
